EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.4.g.subject: Transparency Obligations

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.5.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
5. The supply of incorrect, incomplete or misleading information to notified bodies or national competent authorities in reply to a request shall be subject to administrative fines of up to 7 500 000 EUR or, if the offender is an undertaking, up to 1 % of its total worldwide annual turnover for the preceding financial year, whichever is higher.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.5.recipient: Notified Bodies or National Competent Authorities
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.5.subject: Information

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.6.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
6. In the case of SMEs, including start-ups, each fine referred to in this Article shall be up to the percentages or amount referred to in paragraphs 3, 4 and 5, whichever thereof is lower.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.6.subject: Penalties

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.subject: Specific Situation

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(a) the nature, gravity and duration of the infringement and of its consequences, taking into account the purpose of the AI system, as well as, where appropriate, the number of affected persons and the level of damage suffered by them;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.a.subject: Affected Persons

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(b) whether administrative fines have already been applied by other market surveillance authorities to the same operator for the same infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.b.subject: operator

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(c) whether administrative fines have already been applied by other authorities to the same operator for infringements of other Union or national law, when such infringements result from the same activity or omission constituting a relevant infringement of this Regulation;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.c.recipient: Competent authority under the AI Act
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.c.subject: Operator

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.d.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(d) the size, the annual turnover and market share of the operator committing the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.d.subject: Operator

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.e.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(e) any other aggravating or mitigating factor applicable to the circumstances of the case, such as financial benefits gained, or losses avoided, directly or indirectly, from the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.e.subject: Infringing Entity

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.f.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(f) the degree of cooperation with the national competent authorities, in order to remedy the infringement and mitigate the possible adverse effects of the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.f.subject: Infringement details
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.f.purpose: Remedy the infringement and mitigate adverse effects

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.g.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(g) the degree of responsibility of the operator taking into account the technical and organisational measures implemented by it;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.g.subject: Operator
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.g.information_type: Degree of responsibility, technical and organisational measures

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.h.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(h) the manner in which the infringement became known to the national competent authorities, in particular whether, and if so to what extent, the operator notified the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.h.subject: infringement

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.i.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(i) the intentional or negligent character of the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.i.subject: Infringement

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.j.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
7. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and, as appropriate, regard shall be given to the following:
(j) any action taken by the operator to mitigate the harm suffered by the affected persons.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.7.j.subject: affected persons

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.8.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
8. Each Member State shall lay down rules on to what extent administrative fines may be imposed on public authorities and bodies established in that Member State.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.8.subject: Administrative Fines

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.9.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
9. Depending on the legal system of the Member States, the rules on administrative fines may be applied in such a manner that the fines are imposed by competent national courts or by other bodies, as applicable in those Member States. The application of such rules in those Member States shall have an equivalent effect.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.9.recipient: Competent National Courts or Other Bodies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.9.subject: Administrative Fines

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.10.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
10. The exercise of powers under this Article shall be subject to appropriate procedural safeguards in accordance with Union and national law, including effective judicial remedies and due process.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.10.subject: Procedural Safeguards

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.11.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 99: Penalties
11. Member States shall, on an annual basis, report to the Commission about the administrative fines they have issued during that year, in accordance with this Article, and about any related litigation or judicial proceedings.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.11.subject: Administrative Fines
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article99.11.information_type: Report on administrative fines and related litigation or judicial proceedings

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.sender: Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.subject: Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.subject: Administrative fines

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(a) the nature, gravity and duration of the infringement and of its consequences, taking into account the purpose of the AI system concerned, as well as, where appropriate, the number of affected persons and the level of damage suffered by them;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.a.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.a.subject: Infringing entities
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.a.information_type: Nature, gravity, duration of infringement, consequences, purpose of AI system, number of affected persons, level of damage

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(b) the degree of responsibility of the Union institution, body, office or agency, taking into account technical and organisational measures implemented by them;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.b.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices, and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.b.subject: Union institutions, bodies, offices, and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.b.information_type: Degree of responsibility, technical and organisational measures

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(c) any action taken by the Union institution, body, office or agency to mitigate the damage suffered by affected persons;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.c.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.c.subject: Affected persons

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.d.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(d) the degree of cooperation with the European Data Protection Supervisor in order to remedy the infringement and mitigate the possible adverse effects of the infringement, including compliance with any of the measures previously ordered by the European Data Protection Supervisor against the Union institution, body, office or agency concerned with regard to the same subject matter;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.d.sender: Union institution, body, office or agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.d.subject: Union institution, body, office or agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.d.purpose: To determine administrative fines and mitigate adverse effects

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.e.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(e) any similar previous infringements by the Union institution, body, office or agency;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.e.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices, and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.e.subject: Union institutions, bodies, offices, and agencies

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.f.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(f) the manner in which the infringement became known to the European Data Protection Supervisor, in particular whether, and if so to what extent, the Union institution, body, office or agency notified the infringement;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.f.sender: Union institution, body, office or agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.f.subject: Infringement

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.g.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
1. The European Data Protection Supervisor may impose administrative fines on Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies falling within the scope of this Regulation. When deciding whether to impose an administrative fine and when deciding on the amount of the administrative fine in each individual case, all relevant circumstances of the specific situation shall be taken into account and due regard shall be given to the following:
(g) the annual budget of the Union institution, body, office or agency.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.g.recipient: Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.1.g.subject: Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.2.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
2. Non-compliance with the prohibition of the AI practices referred to in Article 5 shall be subject to administrative fines of up to EUR 1 500 000.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.2.sender: Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.2.subject: Prohibited AI practices

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.3.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
3. The non-compliance of the AI system with any requirements or obligations under this Regulation, other than those laid down in Articles 5, shall be subject to administrative fines of up to EUR 750 000.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.3.sender: Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.3.subject: AI System

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.4.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
4. Before taking decisions pursuant to this Article, the European Data Protection Supervisor shall give the Union institution, body, office or agency which is the subject of the proceedings conducted by the European Data Protection Supervisor the opportunity of being heard on the matter regarding the possible infringement. The European Data Protection Supervisor shall base his or her decisions only on elements and circumstances on which the parties concerned have been able to comment. Complainants, if any, shall be associated closely with the proceedings.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.4.recipient: Union institution, body, office or agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.4.subject: Union institution, body, office or agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.4.purpose: Ensure fair hearing and decision-making process

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.5.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
5. The rights of defence of the parties concerned shall be fully respected in the proceedings. They shall be entitled to have access to the European Data Protection Supervisor’s file, subject to the legitimate interest of individuals or undertakings in the protection of their personal data or business secrets.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.5.subject: Individuals or Undertakings

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.6.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
6. Funds collected by imposition of fines in this Article shall contribute to the general budget of the Union. The fines shall not affect the effective operation of the Union institution, body, office or agency fined.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.6.sender: Union Institution, Body, Office or Agency
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.6.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.7.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 100: Administrative Fines on Union Institutions, Bodies, Offices and Agencies
7. The European Data Protection Supervisor shall, on an annual basis, notify the Commission of the administrative fines it has imposed pursuant to this Article and of any litigation or judicial proceedings it has initiated.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article100.7.subject: Administrative Fines and Litigation Information

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.subject: General-Purpose AI Model

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
1. The Commission may impose on providers of general-purpose AI models fines not exceeding 3 % of their annual total worldwide turnover in the preceding financial year or EUR 15 000 000, whichever is higher., when the Commission finds that the provider intentionally or negligently:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.subject: General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
1. The Commission may impose on providers of general-purpose AI models fines not exceeding 3 % of their annual total worldwide turnover in the preceding financial year or EUR 15 000 000, whichever is higher., when the Commission finds that the provider intentionally or negligently:
(a) infringed the relevant provisions of this Regulation;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.a.subject: Regulation

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
1. The Commission may impose on providers of general-purpose AI models fines not exceeding 3 % of their annual total worldwide turnover in the preceding financial year or EUR 15 000 000, whichever is higher., when the Commission finds that the provider intentionally or negligently:
(b) failed to comply with a request for a document or for information pursuant to Article 91, or supplied incorrect, incomplete or misleading information;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.b.subject: General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
1. The Commission may impose on providers of general-purpose AI models fines not exceeding 3 % of their annual total worldwide turnover in the preceding financial year or EUR 15 000 000, whichever is higher., when the Commission finds that the provider intentionally or negligently:
(c) failed to comply with a measure requested under Article 93;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.c.subject: Providers of General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.d.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
1. The Commission may impose on providers of general-purpose AI models fines not exceeding 3 % of their annual total worldwide turnover in the preceding financial year or EUR 15 000 000, whichever is higher., when the Commission finds that the provider intentionally or negligently:
(d) failed to make available to the Commission access to the general-purpose AI model or general-purpose AI model with systemic risk with a view to conducting an evaluation pursuant to Article 92. In fixing the amount of the fine or periodic penalty payment, regard shall be had to the nature, gravity and duration of the infringement, taking due account of the principles of proportionality and appropriateness. The Commission shall also into account commitments made in accordance with Article 93(3) or made in relevant codes of practice in accordance with Article 56.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.1.d.subject: General-Purpose AI Model

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.2.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
2. Before adopting the decision pursuant to paragraph 1, the Commission shall communicate its preliminary findings to the provider of the general-purpose AI model and give it an opportunity to be heard.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.2.subject: Preliminary Findings

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.3.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
3. Fines imposed in accordance with this Article shall be effective, proportionate and dissuasive.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.3.subject: General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.4.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
4. Information on fines imposed under this Article shall also be communicated to the Board as appropriate.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.4.subject: Provider of General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.5.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
5. The Court of Justice of the European Union shall have unlimited jurisdiction to review decisions of the Commission fixing a fine under this Article. It may cancel, reduce or increase the fine imposed.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.5.sender: Court of Justice of the European Union
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.5.subject: Providers of General-Purpose AI Models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.6.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XII: Penalties
Article 101: Fines for Providers of General-Purpose AI Models
6. The Commission shall adopt implementing acts containing detailed arrangements and procedural safeguards for proceedings in view of the possible adoption of decisions pursuant to paragraph 1 of this Article. Those implementing acts shall be adopted in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 98(2).
EU_AI_ACT.chapter12.article101.6.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article102.‘W.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 102: Amendment to Regulation (EC) No 300/2008
‘When adopting detailed measures related to technical specifications and procedures for approval and use of security equipment concerning Artificial Intelligence systems within the meaning of Regulation (EU) 2024/1689 of the European Parliament and of the Council[*] , the requirements set out in Chapter III, Section 2, of that Regulation shall be taken into account.’

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article102.‘W.subject: Security equipment concerning AI systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 111: AI Systems Already Placed on the Market or put into Service and General-Purpose AI Models Already Placed on the Marked
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.subject: AI System

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.1.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 111: AI Systems Already Placed on the Market or put into Service and General-Purpose AI Models Already Placed on the Marked
1. Without prejudice to the application of Article 5 as referred to in Article 113(3), point (a), AI systems which are components of the large-scale IT systems established by the legal acts listed in Annex X that have been placed on the market or put into service before 2 August 2027 shall be brought into compliance with this Regulation by 31 December 2030. The requirements laid down in this Regulation shall be taken into account in the evaluation of each large-scale IT system established by the legal acts listed in Annex X to be undertaken as provided for in those legal acts and where those legal acts are replaced or amended.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.1.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.2.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 111: AI Systems Already Placed on the Market or put into Service and General-Purpose AI Models Already Placed on the Marked
2. Without prejudice to the application of Article 5 as referred to in Article 113(3), point (a), this Regulation shall apply to operators of high-risk AI systems, other than the systems referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, that have been placed on the market or put into service before 2 August 2026, only if, as from that date, those systems are subject to significant changes in their designs. In any case, the providers and deployers of high-risk AI systems intended to be used by public authorities shall take the necessary steps to comply with the requirements and obligations of this Regulation by 2 August 2030.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.2.subject: high-risk AI systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.3.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 111: AI Systems Already Placed on the Market or put into Service and General-Purpose AI Models Already Placed on the Marked
3. Providers of general-purpose AI models that have been placed on the market before 2 August 2025 shall take the necessary steps in order to comply with the obligations laid down in this Regulation by 2 August 2027.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article111.3.subject: General-purpose AI models

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.1.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
1. The Commission shall assess the need for amendment of the list set out in Annex III and of the list of prohibited AI practices laid down in Article 5, once a year following the entry into force of this Regulation, and until the end of the period of the delegation of power laid down in Article 97. The Commission shall submit the findings of that assessment to the European Parliament and the Council.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.1.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
2. By 2 August 2028 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate and report to the European Parliament and to the Council on the following:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.subject: Evaluation and Report

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
2. By 2 August 2028 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate and report to the European Parliament and to the Council on the following:
(a) the need for amendments extending existing area headings or adding new area headings in Annex III;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.a.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
2. By 2 August 2028 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate and report to the European Parliament and to the Council on the following:
(b) amendments to the list of AI systems requiring additional transparency measures in Article 50;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.b.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
2. By 2 August 2028 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate and report to the European Parliament and to the Council on the following:
(c) amendments enhancing the effectiveness of the supervision and governance system.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.2.c.subject: Supervision and Governance System

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.3.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
3. By 2 August 2029 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall submit a report on the evaluation and review of this Regulation to the European Parliament and to the Council. The report shall include an assessment with regard to the structure of enforcement and the possible need for a Union agency to resolve any identified shortcomings. On the basis of the findings, that report shall, where appropriate, be accompanied by a proposal for amendment of this Regulation. The reports shall be made public.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.3.subject: Regulation

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
4. The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall pay specific attention to the following:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
4. The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall pay specific attention to the following:
(a) the status of the financial, technical and human resources of the national competent authorities in order to effectively perform the tasks assigned to them under this Regulation;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.a.subject: National Competent Authorities
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.a.information_type: Status of financial, technical, and human resources

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
4. The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall pay specific attention to the following:
(b) the state of penalties, in particular administrative fines as referred to in Article 99(1), applied by Member States for infringements of this Regulation;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.b.subject: Infringements

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
4. The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall pay specific attention to the following:
(c) adopted harmonised standards and common specifications developed to support this Regulation;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.c.subject: Harmonised Standards and Common Specifications

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.d.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
4. The reports referred to in paragraph 2 shall pay specific attention to the following:
(d) the number of undertakings that enter the market after the entry into application of this Regulation, and how many of them are SMEs.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.4.d.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.5.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
5. By 2 August 2028, the Commission shall evaluate the functioning of the AI Office, whether the AI Office has been given sufficient powers and competences to fulfil its tasks, and whether it would be relevant and needed for the proper implementation and enforcement of this Regulation to upgrade the AI Office and its enforcement competences and to increase its resources. The Commission shall submit a report on its evaluation to the European Parliament and to the Council.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.5.subject: AI Office

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.6.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
6. By 2 August 2028 and every four years thereafter, the Commission shall submit a report on the review of the progress on the development of standardisation deliverables on the energy-efficient development of general-purpose AI models, and asses the need for further measures or actions, including binding measures or actions. The report shall be submitted to the European Parliament and to the Council, and it shall be made public.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.6.subject: General-purpose AI models
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.6.information_type: Report on standardisation deliverables and need for further measures

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.7.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
7. By 2 August 2028 and every three years thereafter, the Commission shall evaluate the impact and effectiveness of voluntary codes of conduct to foster the application of the requirements set out in Chapter III, Section 2 for AI systems other than high-risk AI systems and possibly other additional requirements for AI systems other than high-risk AI systems, including as regards environmental sustainability.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.7.subject: Voluntary Codes of Conduct

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.8.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
8. For the purposes of paragraphs 1 to 7, the Board, the Member States and national competent authorities shall provide the Commission with information upon its request and without undue delay.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.8.sender: Board, Member States, national competent authorities
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.8.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.9.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
9. In carrying out the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 7, the Commission shall take into account the positions and findings of the Board, of the European Parliament, of the Council, and of other relevant bodies or sources.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.9.recipient: Board, European Parliament, Council, and other relevant bodies or sources
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.9.subject: Evaluations and Reviews
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.9.purpose: To take into account various positions and findings in evaluations and reviews

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.10.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
10. The Commission shall, if necessary, submit appropriate proposals to amend this Regulation, in particular taking into account developments in technology, the effect of AI systems on health and safety, and on fundamental rights, and in light of the state of progress in the information society.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.10.subject: AI Systems
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.10.information_type: Developments in technology, effect on health and safety, fundamental rights, state of progress in the information society

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
11. To guide the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 7 of this Article, the AI Office shall undertake to develop an objective and participative methodology for the evaluation of risk levels based on the criteria outlined in the relevant Articles and the inclusion of new systems in:
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.subject: Risk Levels

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.a.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
11. To guide the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 7 of this Article, the AI Office shall undertake to develop an objective and participative methodology for the evaluation of risk levels based on the criteria outlined in the relevant Articles and the inclusion of new systems in:
(a) the list set out in Annex III, including the extension of existing area headings or the addition of new area headings in that Annex;
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.a.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.b.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
11. To guide the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 7 of this Article, the AI Office shall undertake to develop an objective and participative methodology for the evaluation of risk levels based on the criteria outlined in the relevant Articles and the inclusion of new systems in:
(b) the list of prohibited practices set out in Article 5; and
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.b.subject: Risk Levels

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.c.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
11. To guide the evaluations and reviews referred to in paragraphs 1 to 7 of this Article, the AI Office shall undertake to develop an objective and participative methodology for the evaluation of risk levels based on the criteria outlined in the relevant Articles and the inclusion of new systems in:
(c) the list of AI systems requiring additional transparency measures pursuant to Article 50.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.11.c.subject: AI Systems

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.12.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
12. Any amendment to this Regulation pursuant to paragraph 10, or relevant delegated or implementing acts, which concerns sectoral Union harmonisation legislation listed in Section B of Annex I shall take into account the regulatory specificities of each sector, and the existing governance, conformity assessment and enforcement mechanisms and authorities established therein.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.12.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.13.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 112: Evaluation and Review
13. By 2 August 2031, the Commission shall carry out an assessment of the enforcement of this Regulation and shall report on it to the European Parliament, the Council and the European Economic and Social Committee, taking into account the first years of application of this Regulation. On the basis of the findings, that report shall, where appropriate, be accompanied by a proposal for amendment of this Regulation with regard to the structure of enforcement and the need for a Union agency to resolve any identified shortcomings.
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article112.13.subject: Regulation

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article113.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 113: Entry into Force and Application
EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article113.subject: None

EU_AI_ACT.chapter13.article113.Th.text:
EU Artificial Intelligence Act
Chapter XIII:
Final Provisions
Article 113: Entry into Force and Application
This Regulation shall enter into force on the twentieth day following that of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.
